subject: Re: [junit] Location of test files
msgSnippet: ... I have a test directory structure, with source , classes and data . The directories are self-documenting, I think. :) Now you can either load files
messageBody:
Ray Tayek wrote:

> Hi, I have this package that requires a lot of test files, so I put them in
> com/foo/package/testfiles. I then use class.getresource and decode url or
> open as input stream to read them (stuck with jaca 1.3). This requires a
> copy in ant so they can be found and works fine. Eclipse seems happy to copy
> them as resources to the build directory. So so far, no real problemsas we
> can build and run from the command line using ant, by using ant from within
> eclipse and jut by using eclipse sans ant. Eventually we want to put this
> into cvs.
>
> I was wonderinf what other people do about their test files.

I have a "test" directory structure, with "source", "classes" and
"data". The directories are self-documenting, I think. :)

Now you can either load files from the class path or from test/data.
Just make the test/data folder configurable through something like a JVM
property.
